attributes.action: Stop nurses paying an annual registration fee to register to do their job.
attributes.additional_details: Every year, nurses pay over £100 to register as a nurse. And they pay even more if they have to register specific skills such as being a District Nurse or to prescribe drugs. The more valuable services they provide, the more they pay. They receive nothing back for this and pay Union fees on top. It is just so they can do their jobs. No other public service has to pay for this. Police and fire fighters don't pay to register. Put that little bit of money back in our valuable nurses pockets!
attributes.background: I want the Government to put a stop to nurses having to pay a registration fee each year.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307399

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
